Message.Msg: amzn likes to double top - there have been several smaller double tops but the big one in 1999 looks ripe to repeat 2012 - the stage is set with declining growth/cash/earnings about to hit a 2012 holiday season with very very high expectations on revenue. Message.Msg: After the latest earnings report, both Yahoo and Ameritrade posted earnings (from about 35 analysts) of 16c vs 2c estimates. Sloppy or intentional?

Topic.Title: Earnings Question

Message.Msg: With year over year earnings decreases, month over month earnings decreases, a current PE of 200 plus, how does AMZN continue to rise? Sometime in the next few years will the stock earn $20 per share to justify it's price? Are we assuming no problems in the future such as the effect of sales taxes? Don't get me wrong. I am a huge buyer from Amazon. Love the store, but sales taxes would definitely affect my buying. This is no longer a start-up company. It is about time it started ponying up with some earnings. You can't continue to say you are keeping earnings low to build the business for the future. At least not this low. Bottom line: This perhaps the most overvalued "established" company I have ever seen.

Topic.Title: Sold it all at a loss and went short

Message.Msg: Good move!! However, keep in mind this stock is totally disconnected from the prospects of AMZN the low margin internet retailer company. The stock price controllers can do anything they want with this stock price. AMZN should be trading a lot lower than it is now based on prospects and valuation alone, but the crooks continue to levitate the stock price. Rocket it up on nothing, but then act is if it can never go negative. Example...the last earnings report and forecasted loss for the upcoming quarter did not even cause it to go down. If AAPL had forecasted a loss for the upcoming quarter, the stock would have been instantly pulverized and the wall street croonies will have been releasing a major amount of negative articles. AMZN the stock is enjoying wall street favor at this time..all negatives are ignored and slight positives are over-amplified. Even if the SEC announce an investigation into AMZN accounting, the stock would go up LOL !!

Topic.Title: This stok iz gonna saw baggie's accts in half just like

Message.Msg: Sybs: As always, people need to be patient. This scam is bigger than any other one I know. Seriously. Smart growth investors should be selling this and buying GMCR. Unlike AMZN, GMCR has completed most of its key investments (has excess manufacturing capacity) and occupies an unbelievably strategic position within the retail coffee business (it can destroy the much larger retail QSR value pools if SBUX, DNKN and others try to squeeze its margins). Trading last about 10X forward earnings. The irony is that everyone is arguing for Amazon's cost advantage. The difference is GMCR has a structural cost advantage and is investing in CapEx that will provide ongoing leverage and increasing cash flows. But, no one is an investor anymore. Just traders...

Message.Title: Can Amazon meet or beat
Message.Msg: next Quarter ? Another 30% revenue growth, I don't think so. Best Buy, Walmart.....everyone matching their prices. And you can take delivery,return in store. Google Nexus taking market from Kindle, a direct sale from Google. You can't even buy it from Amazon. Texas started charging sales tax on Amazon in July, that's a big market. Most likely revenue will be flat, margin will be low. Estimates have to be lowered.

Topic.Title: Can Amazon meet or beat

Message.Msg: "Can Amazon meet or beat next Quarter ?" Even if you had the answer to that now, you would not be able to predict the reaction of the stock. "Most likely revenue will be flat" No. "margin will be low." Yes. "Estimates have to be lowered." They will be.

Topic.Title: hey Chalk back over 231! think we can end green today?

Message.Msg: Chalk: Economic news will beat tomorrow. Fed would have intervened if they weren't trending the right way. BUT... KGC's implosion is a black swan of sorts. It is yet another healthy blow to the investing public's trust/faith in the capital markets. Most people don't get that the market's inexorable rise was due largely to demographics and the development of 401K's. Those demographics are working in reverse and KGC like events simply assures net outflows. Institutional longs have to ask themselves, do they want to be exposed to stocks where faulty or malicious algo could wipe out huge value quickly... Because all these MOMO stocks are a mulfunctioning algo away from an irrecoverable price decline. The same cannot be said for companies with huge cash balances and 10% FCF yield... Especially with the Cap gains headwind, I'm more than comfortable staying short. I still think long GOOG short AMZN is a VERY safe paired trade... Google will be increasingly focused on causing pain for AMZN moving forward...

Topic.Title: Best story of the day-Fido owns big piece of Knight
